result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron R Sain

records.addlTxt:
9:22 AM Defendant Aaron R Sain in court.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Aaron R Sain. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CM-95 and 22CM-26. 

Court calls cases.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing today.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 21CM-95 Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
22CM-26: Dismissed and read in.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CM-95: Count 1: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 21CM-95, contrary to the statute section stated therein.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
21CM-95: Count 2: Dismissed and read in.
2CM-26: Dismissed and read in.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Atty Dodge makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Soule makes sentencing arguments to the court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
21CM-95:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $50 plus costs. 
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Submit DNA Sample.
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan today.

20 days in which to appeal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

02:03 PM Defendant Aaron R Sain in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant does intend to be represented and has not seen the public defender for this case yet but will be doing so.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered by the court on the defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $250 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
